Class BrickRotator

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.model.bricks.BrickRotator
public class BrickRotator extends Object
Handles brick rotation and tracks the current rotation state. Uses a RotationStrategy to determine valid rotation positions.

This class manages:

  • The current brick and its rotation state
  • Rotation attempts with wall-kick support
  • Previewing the next rotation state
See Also:
  • RotationStrategy
  • StandardRotationStrategy

    • BrickRotator

      public BrickRotator()
      Constructs a BrickRotator with the default rotation strategy.

    • BrickRotator

      public BrickRotator(RotationStrategy rotationStrategy)
      Constructs a BrickRotator with a custom rotation strategy.
      Parameters:
      rotationStrategy - the strategy for finding valid rotation positions

  • Method Details

    • peekNextRotation

      public NextShapeInfo peekNextRotation()
      Previews the next rotation state without applying it.
      Returns:
      information about the next rotation shape and index
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no brick has been assigned

    • getCurrentShape

      public int[][] getCurrentShape()
      Gets the current rotation state's shape matrix.
      Returns:
      the 2D array representing the current shape
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no brick has been assigned

    • tryRotateLeft

      public Point tryRotateLeft(int[][] boardMatrix, Point offset)
      Attempts to rotate the brick left (counterclockwise). Uses the rotation strategy to find a valid position with wall-kicks.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the current board state for collision detection
      offset - the current position of the brick
      Returns:
      the new offset if rotation succeeded, null if blocked

    • setCurrentShape

      public void setCurrentShape(int currentShape)
      Sets the current rotation state index directly.
      Parameters:
      currentShape - the rotation state index to set

    • setBrick

      public void setBrick(Brick brick)
      Sets a new brick and resets the rotation state to 0.
      Parameters:
      brick - the brick to assign (will be cloned)

    • getBrickShapes

      private List<int[][]> getBrickShapes()

    • getRotationStateCount

      public int getRotationStateCount()
      Returns the total number of rotation states for the current brick.
      Returns:
      the count of rotation states, or 0 if no brick assigned

    • getCurrentShapeIndex

      public int getCurrentShapeIndex()
      Returns the current rotation state index.
      Returns:
      the current shape index (0 to rotationStateCount-1)
